original_definition: 'redispatching' means a measure activated by one or several system operators by altering the generation and/or load pattern in order to change physical flows in the transmission system and relieve a physical congestion;
generated_definition: 'redispatching' means refers to the process of re-routing or re-directing electricity flows in a power system, typically through the use of advanced technologies such as smart grid systems, to optimize energy efficiency and reduce costs.

Article 2: ‘redispatching’ means a measure activated by one or several system operators by altering the generation and/or load pattern in order to change physical flows in the transmission system and relieve a physical congestion;
